title: Can 'Empowered' Recall be removed in Season7?

embed.description: Baron Nashor is the most powerful neutral monster on Summoner's Rift in League of Legends. It is described in-game as follows: "This is a very powerful hostile monster, approach with caution! Killing this monster will yield great monetary and magical rewards to the team, but it should not be confronted alone".

body:
First off, in Season 6 we got every game homeguard bonuses to both bases post 20th min. mark. Having that+recall timer shortened by half really killed macro play in favor of  teamfights coming into Season 6.  Now it always comes down to 5v5 teamfights at Baron, smiting/stealing the objective and snowballing a game off of that, since the reward is higher than ever, a well-known meme might say way too high! Many champions rely on split pushing, and we are yet to see a split pushing comp/base race in competitive play due to all this.
TL;DR Please consider removing empowered recall in the next season. Faithfully yours, a season 2 LoL veteran.

replies.body: You aren't a veteran at D5. Maybe D3, but def not D5.

Says silver III guy. http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=XTRMN00B1337 

I'm a veteran because I've been playing this game since season 2.

My rank doesn't matter. D5 is barely out of platinum, if you plan on calling yourself among the best of the best you need to be at least D4-D3. Stop trying to make a shit excuse by talking about mine.
He's not calling himself the best. Veteran just means that he's been around for awhile, in this case since season 2. You don't have to be good to be a veteran, just experienced.

You do know what war is, right?

A veteran is nothing to do with skill level it is about experience. It is about having been, seen, fought, and survived. It is not about having won.
THey are removing the Homeguard affect next season, keep the empowered recall.
i thought you were serious for a second.
